circumstances: The crew was completing a single engine positioning flight from El Paso to Lubbock. En route, the remaining engine failed, forcing the crew to attempt an emergency landing. The airplane belly landed in a desert area located in the region of Seminole. Both occupants escaped with minor injuries while the aircraft was damaged beyond repair.
probable_cause:
In-flight engine malfunction and subsequent wheels-up landing caused by a cylinder assembly failure. The following contributing factors were reported: 
- Material failure, 
- Intentional wheels-up landing, 
- Fire in engine, 
- Fire warning system: powerplant,
- Complete engine failure, 
- Forced landing off airport on land, 
- Single engine ferry flight to repair the other engine.
